org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.machineid

Class MachineIdProperties

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.processors.machineid.MachineIdProperties

  • public class MachineIdProperties
extends Object
    This class specifies properties specific to the Machine ID Processor.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MachineIdProperties()
      Constructs an empty set of machine ID properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property).
      MachineIdProperties(MachineIdProperties properties)
      Creates a set of machine ID properties from an existing set of machine ID properties, making a defensive copy.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MachineIdProperties

        public MachineIdProperties()
        Constructs an empty set of machine ID properties, with most values being set to null, 0, or empty (depending on the type of the property). Usually this constructor is used if this configuration POJO is populated in an automated fashion (e.g. injection). If you need to build them manually (possibly with defaults), use or create a properties builder.

        You can change the defaults with the setters.

        See Also:
        MapBasedCommonPropsBuilder, MapBasedCommonPropsBuilder

      • MachineIdProperties

        public MachineIdProperties(MachineIdProperties properties)
        Creates a set of machine ID properties from an existing set of machine ID properties, making a defensive copy.
        Parameters:
        properties - The set of properties to copy
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When properties is null
        See Also:
        MachineIdProperties()

    • Method Detail

      • getMachineId

        public final String getMachineId()
        Returns:
        The machine ID of this machine (may be null if no machine ID has been configured)
        See Also:
        setMachineId(String)

      • setMachineId

        public final void setMachineId(String machineId)
        Set the machine ID of this machine.

        If no machine ID is set, implementations may try alternative means to determine a unique ID for the machine.

        Parameters:
        machineId - The ID of this machine

      • getEventFieldName

        public final String getEventFieldName()
        Returns:
        The field name used to store the machine ID in events
        See Also:
        setEventFieldName(String)

      • setEventFieldName

        public final void setEventFieldName(String eventFieldName)
        Set the field name to be used when storing the machine ID in audit events
        Parameters:
        eventFieldName - The field name to store the machine ID in
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When the eventFieldName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When the eventFieldName is empty

      • isMachineIdFromEnv

        public final boolean isMachineIdFromEnv()
        Returns:
        the indication of whether the machine ID should be read from an environment variable
        See Also:
        setMachineIdFromEnv(boolean)

      • setMachineIdFromEnv

        public final void setMachineIdFromEnv(boolean machineIdFromEnv)
        The indication of whether the machine ID should be read from an environment variable.

        If no machine ID can be obtained, implementations may try alternative means to determine a unique ID for the machine.

        Parameters:
        machineIdFromEnv - the indication of whether objects will be read from the environment

      • getMachineIdEnvName

        public final String getMachineIdEnvName()
        Returns:
        The name of the env variable from which the machine of this machine should be read (may be null)
        See Also:
        setMachineIdEnvName(String)

      • setMachineIdEnvName

        public final void setMachineIdEnvName(String machineIdEnvName)
        Set the name of the environment variable from which the machine ID of this machine should be read

        If no machine ID can be obtained, implementations may try alternative means to determine a unique ID for the machine.

        Parameters:
        machineIdEnvName - The name of the env var to get the ID of this machine from

      • isMachineIdFromHostname

        public final boolean isMachineIdFromHostname()
        Returns:
        the indication of whether the machine ID should be created from the hostname
        See Also:
        setMachineIdFromHostname(boolean)

      • setMachineIdFromHostname

        public final void setMachineIdFromHostname(boolean machineIdFromHostname)
        The indication of whether the machine ID should be created from the hostname

        If no machine ID can be obtained, implementations may try alternative means to determine a unique ID for the machine.

        Parameters:
        machineIdFromHostname - the indication of whether the machine ID will be created based on the hostname

      • getAdditionalProperties

        public final Map<String,String> getAdditionalProperties()
        Returns:
        Any additional properties stored in this object that have not explicitly been parsed
        See Also:
        setAdditionalProperties(Map)

      • setAdditionalProperties

        public final void setAdditionalProperties(Map<String,String> additionalProperties)
        Any additional properties which have not been parsed, and for which no getter/setter exists, but are to be stored in this object nevertheless.

        This property is commonly used to preserve original properties from upstream components that are to be passed on to downstream components unchanged. This properties set may or may not include properties that have been extracted from the map, and been made available through this POJO.

        Note that these additional properties may be null or empty, even in a fully populated POJO where other properties commonly have values assigned to.

        Parameters:
        additionalProperties - The additional properties to store
